original_data.Title: Intellectual Property Law Specialization
original_data.Short Intro: Become fluent in the rules of the new economy. Learn how to use intellectual property law to protect and maximize the value of your innovations

original_data.Title: Nuts and Bolts of U.S. Immigration Law
original_data.Short Intro: This course begins by exploring short term entry and long term entry into the United States. We will cover the various means of short term entry and long term entry, as well as the general application processes. We will also examine exclusion and deportation in the United States. In particular, we will discuss how and why individuals may not be admitted into the United States and possible reasons for deportation or removal. Lastly, we will cover the process of how to become a United States citizen and the various requirements for naturalization.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: English

unified_data.title: Nuts and Bolts of U.S. Immigration Law
unified_data.description: This course begins by exploring short term entry and long term entry into the United States. We will cover the various means of short term entry and long term entry, as well as the general application processes. We will also examine exclusion and deportation in the United States. In particular, we will discuss how and why individuals may not be admitted into the United States and possible reasons for deportation or removal. Lastly, we will cover the process of how to become a United States citizen and the various requirements for naturalization.
learning_outcomes: Analyze the application processes for various types of visas and immigration statuses.
Understand the different pathways for short-term and long-term entry into the U.S.
Explain the steps and requirements for becoming a naturalized U.S. citizen.
Apply relevant laws and regulations to hypothetical immigration scenarios.
Identify grounds for exclusion and deportation under U.S. immigration law.

original_data.Title: American Contract Law I
original_data.Short Intro: American Contract Law I (along with its sister course Contracts II) provides a comprehensive overview of contract law in the United States. The course covers most of the key concepts found in a first year law school class. Each lecture is based on one or more common-law cases, integrating legal doctrines with policy discussions. The course also covers key sections from the Uniform Commercial Code (UCC), which governs the sale of goods.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: Arabic, French, Portuguese (European), Italian, Vietnamese, German, Russian, English, Spanish

unified_data.title: American Contract Law I
unified_data.description: American Contract Law I along with its sister course Contracts II provides a comprehensive overview of contract law in the United States. The course covers most of the key concepts found in a first year law school class. Each lecture is based on one or more common-law cases, integrating legal doctrines with policy discussions. The course also covers key sections from the Uniform Commercial Code UCC, which governs the sale of goods.
learning_outcomes: Understand the fundamental principles of American contract law.
Analyze the elements required for contract formation.
Evaluate the enforceability of contracts under common law and the UCC.
Interpret key sections of the Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) related to the sale of goods.
Identify potential remedies for breach of contract.
Apply contract law principles to real-world scenarios.

original_data.Title: FinTech Law and Policy
original_data.Short Intro: Being a successful FinTech firm requires more than just great technology; it also requires an understanding of the laws and regulations applicable to your business. This course will provide you with that understanding. You will learn about the critical legal, regulatory, and policy issues associated with cryptocurrencies, initial coin offerings, online lending, new payments and wealth management technologies, and financial account aggregators.  In addition, you will learn how regulatory agencies in the U.S. are continually adjusting to the emergence of new financial technologies and how one specific agency has proposed a path for FinTech firms to become regulated banks. You will also learn the basics of how banks are regulated in the U.S.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: Arabic, French, Portuguese (European), Italian, Vietnamese, German, Russian, English, Spanish

unified_data.title: FinTech Law and Policy
unified_data.description: Being a successful FinTech firm requires more than just great technology; it also requires an understanding of the laws and regulations applicable to your business. This course will provide you with that understanding. You will learn about the critical legal, regulatory, and policy issues associated with cryptocurrencies, initial coin offerings, online lending, new payments and wealth management technologies, and financial account aggregators. In addition, you will learn how regulatory agencies in the U.S. are continually adjusting to the emergence of new financial technologies and how one specific agency has proposed a path for FinTech firms to become regulated banks. You will also learn the basics of how banks are regulated in the U.S.
learning_outcomes: Describe the process by which FinTech firms can become regulated banks in the U.S.
Explain the regulatory framework for wealth management technologies.
Analyze the regulatory issues related to cryptocurrencies and initial coin offerings.
Apply relevant laws and regulations to new payments technologies.
Evaluate the compliance requirements for online lending platforms.
Understand the legal and regulatory landscape for FinTech companies.

original_data.Title: International Law in Action: the Arbitration of International Disputes
original_data.Short Intro: ‘The Arbitration of International Disputes’ is the third course of Leiden University’s  series on International Law in Action. The first course covered generalities on the international courts and tribunals in The Hague, while the second course provided an insider's  perspective into the work of international criminal courts and tribunals.  This third course explores the major aspects of international arbitration as one of the most common method of international dispute settlement . Through this course you will gain an in-depth understanding of the  various facets of international arbitration through the analysis of its role as a mechanism of dispute settlement, its institutions, the fields of law it is applicable to, and, of course, its most famous awards.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: Arabic, French, Portuguese (European), Italian, Vietnamese, German, Russian, English, Spanish

unified_data.title: International Law in Action: the Arbitration of International Disputes
unified_data.description: The Arbitration of International Disputes is the third course of Leiden Universitys series on International Law in Action. The first course covered generalities on the international courts and tribunals in The Hague, while the second course provided an insiders perspective into the work of international criminal courts and tribunals. This third course explores the major aspects of international arbitration as one of the most common method of international dispute settlement . Through this course you will gain an in-depth understanding of the various facets of international arbitration through the analysis of its role as a mechanism of dispute settlement, its institutions, the fields of law it is applicable to, and, of course, its most famous awards.
learning_outcomes: Understand the role and function of international arbitration in dispute settlement.
Evaluate the institutional aspects of various international arbitration bodies.
Apply principles of international law to specific arbitration cases.
Interpret and apply international arbitration awards.
Identify key issues and challenges in contemporary international arbitration.
Analyze the legal framework governing international arbitration proceedings.

original_data.Title: An Introduction to American Law
original_data.Short Intro: This course will give you a glimpse into six different areas of American law: Tort Law, Contract Law, Property, Constitutional Law, Criminal Law, and Civil Procedure. You will gain insight into the complexities and dilemmas that arise from the application of law in different settings, and what is distinctive about American approaches.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: Arabic, French, Portuguese (European), Italian, Vietnamese, German, Russian, English, Spanish

unified_data.title: An Introduction to American Law
unified_data.description: This course will give you a glimpse into six different areas of American law: Tort Law, Contract Law, Property, Constitutional Law, Criminal Law, and Civil Procedure. You will gain insight into the complexities and dilemmas that arise from the application of law in different settings, and what is distinctive about American approaches.
learning_outcomes: Understand the core principles of Tort Law and their practical application.
Explain the fundamental concepts of Property Law, including ownership and transfer.
Identify the elements of various crimes and the procedures of Criminal Law.
Interpret key provisions of Constitutional Law and their impact on individual rights.
Apply the rules of Civil Procedure to resolve disputes in a legal setting.
Analyze the formation, enforcement, and remedies associated with Contract Law.

original_data.Title: Corporate & Commercial Law I: Contracts & Employment Law
original_data.Short Intro: This class deals with the business law topics that appear on the CPA exam: Agency, Contracts, Debtor-Creditor Relationships, Government Regulation of Business, and Business Organizations. Students will gain an understanding of how these areas of the law affect businesses and their operations, with an eye on preparation for the business law portions of the REG section of the CPA exam. By the end of the class, students will be able to identify the legal principles that govern various business situations and apply those principles to an issue to determine the outcome when the law is applied to the facts of a scenario.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: Arabic, French, Portuguese (European), Italian, Vietnamese, German, Russian, English, Spanish

unified_data.title: Corporate  Commercial Law I: Contracts  Employment Law
unified_data.description: This class deals with the business law topics that appear on the CPA exam: Agency, Contracts, Debtor-Creditor Relationships, Government Regulation of Business, and Business Organizations. Students will gain an understanding of how these areas of the law affect businesses and their operations, with an eye on preparation for the business law portions of the REG section of the CPA exam. By the end of the class, students will be able to identify the legal principles that govern various business situations and apply those principles to an issue to determine the outcome when the law is applied to the facts of a scenario.
learning_outcomes: Analyze debtor-creditor relationships and related legal issues.
Identify and evaluate government regulations impacting businesses.
Apply legal principles to fact patterns to determine potential legal outcomes.
Understand the legal principles governing agency relationships.
Apply contract law principles to analyze contract formation, performance, and breach.
Comprehend the legal structures and operations of various business organizations.

original_data.Title: A Law Student's Toolkit
original_data.Short Intro: Whether you are an advanced law student looking to review the basics, or an aspiring law student looking for head start, this course will help you build the foundation you will need to succeed in law school and beyond. This course will introduce you to terminology, concepts, and tools lawyers and legal academics use to make their arguments. It will help you follow these arguments—and make arguments of your own.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: Arabic, French, Portuguese (European), Chinese (Simplified), Italian, Vietnamese, German, Russian, English, Spanish

unified_data.title: A Law Students Toolkit
unified_data.description: Whether you are an advanced law student looking to review the basics, or an aspiring law student looking for head start, this course will help you build the foundation you will need to succeed in law school and beyond. learning_outcomes: Develop effective legal writing skills
Understand core legal terminology and concepts
Apply legal reasoning to analyze legal problems
Construct persuasive legal arguments
Prepare case briefs summarizing legal precedents

original_data.Title: International Humanitarian Law in Theory and Practice
original_data.Short Intro: “International Humanitarian Law in Theory and Practice” is the first MOOC of the Kalshoven-Gieskes Forum on International Humanitarian Law, which is the platform within the Grotius Centre for International Legal Studies of Leiden University for the research, teaching and dissemination of international humanitarian law (IHL).
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: French, Portuguese (European), Russian, English, Spanish

unified_data.title: International Humanitarian Law in Theory and Practice
unified_data.description: International Humanitarian Law in Theory and Practice is the first MOOC of the Kalshoven-Gieskes Forum on International Humanitarian Law, which is the platform within the Grotius Centre for International Legal Studies of Leiden University for the research, teaching and dissemination of international humanitarian law IHL.
learning_outcomes: Apply IHL rules to specific scenarios involving armed conflict
Understand the fundamental principles and sources of International Humanitarian Law (IHL)
Understand the relationship between IHL and other relevant legal frameworks
Identify and address ethical dilemmas related to the application of IHL
Evaluate the role of various actors in enforcing and implementing IHL
Analyze contemporary challenges to IHL in armed conflicts

original_data.Title: Introduction to Environmental Law and Policy
original_data.Short Intro: Environmental law may be the one institution standing between us and planetary exhaustion. It is also an institution that needs to be reconciled with human liberty and economic aspirations. This course considers these issues and provides a tour though existing legal regimes governing pollution, water law, endangered species, toxic substances, environmental impact analyses, and environmental risk.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: Arabic, French, Portuguese (European), Italian, Vietnamese, German, Russian, English, Spanish

unified_data.title: Introduction to Environmental Law and Policy
unified_data.description: Environmental law may be the one institution standing between us and planetary exhaustion. It is also an institution that needs to be reconciled with human liberty and economic aspirations. This course considers these issues and provides a tour though existing legal regimes governing pollution, water law, endangered species, toxic substances, environmental impact analyses, and environmental risk.
learning_outcomes: Evaluate the effectiveness of environmental impact assessments and risk management strategies
Understand the fundamental principles and sources of environmental law
Analyze the legal frameworks governing pollution control, water resources, and endangered species protection
Understand the interplay between environmental law, human liberty, and economic development
Apply legal concepts to real-world environmental problems and case studies

original_data.Short Intro: The common law of England and Wales is one of the major global legal traditions.

original_data.Title: Children's Human Rights - An Interdisciplinary Introduction
original_data.Short Intro: Drawing on the contributions of several academic disciplines including law, psychology, sociology, history, educational and health sciences, economy and anthropology, an interdisciplinary approach guides the student into a selection of critical issues concerning children’s rights. Participants will gain insight relative to the development of this specific human rights category, as well as to the evolution of the challenges faced by children over time and society’s efforts to respond. Successful international strategies and programs promoting children’s rights will be highlighted, as well as the role of key actors involved in international organizations working in this field. This open online course provides an overview of the most important features of children’s human rights. A central portion of the MOOC will consist of a presentation of the international and regional standards on children’s rights and the related international and regional judicial and quasi-judicial bodies designed to ensure their implementation.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: Arabic, French, Portuguese (European), Italian, Vietnamese, German, Russian, Turkish, English, Slovak, Spanish

unified_data.title: Childrens Human Rights - An Interdisciplinary Introduction
unified_data.description: Drawing on the contributions of several academic disciplines including law, psychology, sociology, history, educational and health sciences, economy and anthropology, an interdisciplinary approach guides the student into a selection of critical issues concerning childrens rights. Participants will gain insight relative to the development of this specific human rights category, as well as to the evolution of the challenges faced by children over time and societys efforts to respond. Successful international strategies and programs promoting childrens rights will be highlighted, as well as the role of key actors involved in international organizations working in this field. This open online course provides an overview of the most important features of childrens human rights. A central portion of the MOOC will consist of a presentation of the international and regional standards on childrens rights and the related international and regional judicial and quasi-judicial bodies designed to ensure their implementation.

original_data.Title: Cloud Computing Law: Data Protection and Cybersecurity
original_data.Short Intro: Vast amounts of personal information are processed in the cloud. But who is legally responsible for such ‘personal data’ in cloud environments? What duties do cloud providers like Amazon, Microsoft, and Google have? And what rights can you, as an individual, exercise under data protection law? If you’d like to find out, then this course is for you!
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: English
original_data.Skills: Cybersecurity Regulation,Cloud Services,General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR),International Transfers of Personal Data,Cloud Computing,

If youd like to find out, then this course is for you!

original_data.Title: Copyright Law in the Music Business
original_data.Short Intro: In this course taught by E. Michael Harrington, students will learn the basis for copyright including what is and is not covered by copyright law. This course will help clarify what rights artists have as creators as well as what the public is free to take from their work. Students will also learn what to do if someone copies their work and what to do if they are accused of copying someone else. Finally, the course will discuss how technology has changed copyright for the better (and worse) and how copyright laws may change in the coming years.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: English
original_data.Skills: Create music legally,Read Legal Documents,Leverage the copyright law to your advantage,Write a co-writing agreement,

unified_data.title: Copyright Law in the Music Business

Finally, the course will discuss how technology has changed copyright for the better and worse and how copyright laws may change in the coming years.
skills: Leverage The Copyright Law To Your Advantage

original_data.Title: Patent Law
original_data.Short Intro: In our modern technologically-based economy, the creation and enforcement of patent rights can make or break a business. With record numbers of patents being issued every year, the stakes for inventors (and, indeed, their lawyers) continue to rise, even as the patent law and its administration faces growing criticism.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: English

unified_data.title: Patent Law
unified_data.description: In our modern technologically-based economy, the creation and enforcement of patent rights can make or break a business. With record numbers of patents being issued every year, the stakes for inventors and, indeed, their lawyers continue to rise, even as the patent law and its administration faces growing criticism.

original_data.Title: European Business Law: Understanding the Fundamentals
original_data.Short Intro: The European Union is one of the world’s largest and most important economies. This six week course is the first in a series of three that will provide students with an insight into European Business Law. The series ranges from considering the basic structures and principles of the European Union to focusing on various specialized areas of law. Each course will give the students an understanding of the laws and policies that regulate the internal market of European Union, as well as relevant case law and useful inputs from leading practitioners in the field.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: Arabic, French, Portuguese (European), Italian, Vietnamese, German, Russian, English, Spanish

unified_data.title: European Business Law: Understanding the Fundamentals
unified_data.description: The European Union is one of the worlds largest and most important economies. This six week course is the first in a series of three that will provide students with an insight into European Business Law. The series ranges from considering the basic structures and principles of the European Union to focusing on various specialized areas of law. Each course will give the students an understanding of the laws and policies that regulate the internal market of European Union, as well as relevant case law and useful inputs from leading practitioners in the field.

original_data.Title: Cloud Computing Law: Transactions
original_data.Short Intro: Have you ever wondered what’s in the small print of cloud contracts? Or who owns the information you upload to the cloud? And who can access and control it? If so, then this course is for you! You’ll learn to identify the legal risks involved in cloud computing transactions - and to suggest possible solutions.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: English

original_data.Title: Copyright Law
original_data.Short Intro: Copyright law is unique in the greater intellectual property regime, as it protects original expression that is fixed in a tangible medium and is the product of authorship.  This course is designed for creative professionals — such as screenwriters, musicians, documentary filmmakers or artists — who want to understand the scope and limits of which works can enjoy U.S. copyright protection. The course will introduce students to the workings of copyright law through an examination of the system’s basic principles, rules, and institutions. Topics will include; the justifications for copyright law, copyrightable subject matter, authorship, the nature and scope of copyright’s exclusive rights, fair use, and remedies for infringement.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: English, Spanish

unified_data.description: Copyright law is unique in the greater intellectual property regime, as it protects original expression that is fixed in a tangible medium and is the product of authorship. The course will introduce students to the workings of copyright law through an examination of the systems basic principles, rules, and institutions. Topics will include; the justifications for copyright law, copyrightable subject matter, authorship, the nature and scope of copyrights exclusive rights, fair use, and remedies for infringement.

original_data.Title: Introduction to Intellectual Property
original_data.Short Intro: Intellectual property is the currency of the tech world, with the world’s most valuable intellectual property assets dwarfing the value of their real-world counterparts. Apple’ trademarked brand was valued at over $100 billion as of 2017. J.K. Rowling’s Harry potter franchise has generated over $25 billion to date. But how did the law come to create such enormous value in intangible assets?
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: French, Portuguese (European), German, Russian, English, Spanish

But how did the law come to create such enormous value in intangible assets?

original_data.Title: Trademark Law
original_data.Short Intro: The protections afforded under trademark law have created incredible value in intangible assets, with the value of the world’s most valuable brands such as Amazon, Apple and Google each exceeding $100 billion. But what exactly is trademark law, and how is such enormous value created?
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: English

original_data.Title: Physics 102  - Magnetic Fields and Faraday's Law
original_data.Short Intro: This course serves as an introduction to the physics of electricity and magnetism.  Upon completion, learners will have an understanding of how the forces between electric charges are described by fields, and how these fields are related to electrical circuits. They will gain experience in solving physics problems with tools such as graphical analysis, algebra, vector analysis, and calculus.  The course follows the typical progression of topics of a first-semester university physics course:  charges, electric forces, electric fields potential, magnetic fields, currents, magnetic moments, electromagnetic induction, and circuits.  Each module contains reading links to a free textbook, complete video lectures, conceptual quizzes, and a set of homework problems.  Once the modules are completed, the course ends with an exam.  This comprehensive course series is similar in detail and rigor to what is taught on-campus.  It will thoroughly prepare learners for their upcoming introductory physics courses, or more advanced courses in physics.

Upon completion, learners will have an understanding of how the forces between electric charges are described by fields, and how these fields are related to electrical circuits. They will gain experience in solving physics problems with tools such as graphical analysis, algebra, vector analysis, and calculus. The course follows the typical progression of topics of a first-semester university physics course: charges, electric forces, electric fields potential, magnetic fields, currents, magnetic moments, electromagnetic induction, and circuits. Each module contains reading links to a free textbook, complete video lectures, conceptual quizzes, and a set of homework problems. Once the modules are completed, the course ends with an exam. This comprehensive course series is similar in detail and rigor to what is taught on-campus. It will thoroughly prepare learners for their upcoming introductory physics courses, or more advanced courses in physics.

original_data.Title: European Business Law: Doing Business in Europe
original_data.Short Intro: This six-week course titled Doing Business in Europe is the second in a series of three exploring some of the main business aspects of European Union law. Besides providing learners with a sound knowledge base of European laws and regulations relevant to establishing and managing a company within the European Union, the course also explores business considerations within a broader perspective by including inputs from leading law practitioners in the field. More specifically, the course discusses strategic and financial considerations within Company law, as well as Labour law issues such as restructuring enterprises, working conditions and handling crises situations. The course also examines other legal areas such as Tax law, Environmental law and Private International law, and how they tie in to doing business in Europe.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: French, Portuguese (European), Russian, English, Spanish

unified_data.title: European Business Law: Doing Business in Europe

The course also examines other legal areas such as Tax law, Environmental law and Private International law, and how they tie in to doing business in Europe.

original_data.Title: U.S. Health Law Fundamentals
original_data.Short Intro: This course explores how statutes, regulations, common law, and market forces help or hinder three major goals of policy makers: increasing access, reducing cost, and improving quality. We will examine the Supreme Court’s rulings on the ACA and other legal aspects of modern health care reform. Learners who successfully complete this course will be able to describe the laws, regulations, common law and market forces that shape our health care system and identify areas where ideas and innovation are needed; explain the malpractice system and how it influences medical practice; and analyze legal aspects of the ACA.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: English
original_data.Skills: Healthcare Management,Health Policy Analysis,Health Insurance,Affordable Care Act,
